Principles.Text should have a purpose: Remove fluff. Each word must serve clarity and user progress.
Principles.Be explicit, be direct: State things plainly. Avoid ambiguity and unnecessary politeness that hides meaning.
Principles.Focus on value and benefits, not feature: Explain why it matters. Users care about outcomes, not specs.
Principles.There is no default knowledge: Never assume user expertise. Explain essentials without jargon.
Principles.Prefer the positive: Phrase for confidence and success. Avoid fear‑based wording.
Principles.Success instead of fear, doubt and uncer: Encourage and reassure. Celebrate progress, don't highlight failure.

Tone.Be helpful: Give clear guidance and next steps. Reduce cognitive effort.
Tone.Be empowering: Make users feel capable. Language should support autonomy.
Tone.Be empathetic: Acknowledge emotions in errors or friction. Use human warmth.
Tone.Be confident: Write assertively. Avoid hedging words that reduce trust.
